info.title: Cosmos DB
info.description: Azure Cosmos DB Database Service Resource Provider REST API

head.description: Checks that the Azure Cosmos DB account name already exists. A valid account name may contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and the '-' character, and must be between 3 and 50 characters.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: OK. The account name is valid but is already in use.

404.description: Not Found. The account name is available and valid.

get.description: Lists all of the available Cosmos DB Resource Provider operations.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: OK

get.description: Lists all the Azure Cosmos DB database accounts available under the subscription.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: The operation completed successfully.

get.description: Lists all the Azure Cosmos DB database accounts available under the given resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: The operation completed successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the properties of an existing Azure Cosmos DB database account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: The database account properties were retrieved successfully.

put.description: Creates or updates an Azure Cosmos DB database account. The "Update" method is preferred when performing updates on an account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

requestBody.description: The parameters to provide for the current database account.

200.description: The database account create or update operation will complete asynchronously.

delete.description: Deletes an existing Azure Cosmos DB database account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

202.description: The database account delete operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: The specified account does not exist in the subscription.

patch.description: Updates the properties of an existing Azure Cosmos DB database account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

requestBody.description: The parameters to provide for the current database account.

200.description: The database account update operation will complete asynchronously.

parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: The Cassandra keyspace properties were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Gets the Cassandra keyspaces under an existing Azure Cosmos DB database account with the provided name.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: The Cassandra keyspace property was retrieved successfully.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

requestBody.description: The parameters to provide for the current Cassandra keyspace.

200.description: The Cassandra keyspace create or update operation was completed successfully.

202.description: The Cassandra keyspace create or update operation will complete asynchronously.

delete.description: Deletes an existing Azure Cosmos DB Cassandra keyspace.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

202.description: The Cassandra keyspace delete operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: The Cassandra keyspace delete operation was completed successfully.

requestBody.description: The RUs per second of the parameters to provide for the current Cassandra table.

202.description: The RUs per second of the Cassandra table update operation will complete asynchronously.

get.description: Retrieves metric definitions for the given collection.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: The metric definitions for the collection were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account and collection.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The metrics for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given partition key range id.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: partitionKeyRangeId
parameters.description: Partition Key Range Id for which to get data.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The partition-level metrics for the partition key range id were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given collection, split by partition.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The partition-level metrics for the collection were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the usages (most recent storage data) for the given collection, split by partition.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of usages to return. The supported parameter is name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names).

200.description: The usages for the collection, per partition were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the usages (most recent storage data) for the given collection.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of usages to return. The supported parameter is name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names).

200.description: The usages for the collection were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves metric definitions for the given database.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: The metric definitions for the database were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account and database.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The metrics for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the usages (most recent data) for the given database.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of usages to return. The supported parameter is name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names).

200.description: The usages for the database were retrieved successfully.

post.description: Changes the failover priority for the Azure Cosmos DB database account. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

requestBody.description: The new failover policies for the database account.

202.description: Accepted. The failover policy change operation will complete asynchronously.

post.description: Offline the specified region for the specified Azure Cosmos DB database account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

requestBody.description: Cosmos DB region to offline for the database account.

200.description: The offline region operation is completed successfully.

202.description: Accepted. The offline region operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Online the specified region for the specified Azure Cosmos DB database account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

200.description: The online region operation is completed successfully.

202.description: Accepted. The online region operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account. This url is only for PBS and Replication Latency data

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The percentile metrics for the account were retrieved successfully.

parameters.name: api-version

post.description: Regenerates an access key for the specified Azure Cosmos DB database account.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

requestBody.description: The name of the key to regenerate.

200.description: OK

202.description: Accepted. The regenerate key operation will complete asynchronously.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account, collection and region.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The metrics for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given partition key range id and region.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

parameters.name: partitionKeyRangeId
parameters.description: Partition Key Range Id for which to get data.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The partition-level metrics for the partition key range id and region were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given collection and region, split by partition.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The partition-level metrics for the collection and region were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given database account and region.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The metrics for the database account were retrieved successfully.

get.description: Retrieves the metrics determined by the given filter for the given account, source and target region. This url is only for PBS and Replication Latency data

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

parameters.name: sourceRegion
parameters.description: Source region from which data is written. Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

parameters.name: targetRegion
parameters.description: Target region to which data is written. Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

200.description: The percentile metrics for the account, source and target regions were retrieved successfully.

name.description: Name of the Cosmos DB capability. For example, "name": "EnableCassandra". Current values also include "EnableTable" and "EnableGremlin".

name.description: Name of the Cosmos DB Cassandra table cluster key

orderBy.description: Order of the Cosmos DB Cassandra table cluster key, only support "Asc" and "Desc"

ClusterKey.description: Cosmos DB Cassandra table cluster key

name.description: Name of the Cosmos DB Cassandra table column

type.description: Type of the Cosmos DB Cassandra table column

path.description: The path for which the indexing behavior applies to. Index paths typically start with root and end with wildcard (/path/*)

conflictResolutionPath.description: The conflict resolution path in the case of LastWriterWins mode.

conflictResolutionProcedure.description: The procedure to resolve conflicts in the case of custom mode.

ConflictResolutionPolicy.description: The conflict resolution policy for the container.

ConnectorOffer.description: The cassandra connector offer type for the Cosmos DB C* database account.

defaultConsistencyLevel.description: The default consistency level and configuration settings of the Cosmos DB account.

maxIntervalInSeconds.description: When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the time amount of staleness (in seconds) tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 5 - 86400. Required when defaultConsistencyPolicy is set to 'BoundedStaleness'.

maxStalenessPrefix.description: When used with the Bounded Staleness consistency level, this value represents the number of stale requests tolerated. Accepted range for this value is 1  2,147,483,647. Required when defaultConsistencyPolicy is set to 'BoundedStaleness'.

ConsistencyPolicy.description: The consistency policy for the Cosmos DB database account.

kind.description: Indicates the kind of algorithm used for partitioning

paths.description: List of paths using which data within the container can be partitioned

version.description: Indicates the version of the partition key definition

ContainerPartitionKey.description: The configuration of the partition key to be used for partitioning data into multiple partitions

CreateUpdateOptions.description: CreateUpdateOptions are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource. Supported keys are "If-Match", "If-None-Match", "Session-Token" and "Throughput"

DatabaseAccountConnectionString.description: Connection string for the Cosmos DB account

kind.description: Indicates the type of database account. This can only be set at database account creation.

DatabaseAccountCreateUpdateParameters.description: Parameters to create and update Cosmos DB database accounts.

capabilities.description: List of Cosmos DB capabilities for the account

disableKeyBasedMetadataWriteAccess.description: Disable write operations on metadata resources (databases, containers, throughput) via account keys

enableAutomaticFailover.description: Enables automatic failover of the write region in the rare event that the region is unavailable due to an outage. Automatic failover will result in a new write region for the account and is chosen based on the failover priorities configured for the account.

enableCassandraConnector.description: Enables the cassandra connector on the Cosmos DB C* account

enableMultipleWriteLocations.description: Enables the account to write in multiple locations

isVirtualNetworkFilterEnabled.description: Flag to indicate whether to enable/disable Virtual Network ACL rules.

locations.description: An array that contains the georeplication locations enabled for the Cosmos DB account.

virtualNetworkRules.description: List of Virtual Network ACL rules configured for the Cosmos DB account.

message.description: Error message indicating why the operation failed.

path.description: The path for which the indexing behavior applies to. Index paths typically start with root and end with wildcard (/path/*)

_etag.description: A system generated property representing the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

_rid.description: A system generated property. A unique identifier.

_ts.description: A system generated property that denotes the last updated timestamp of the resource.

ExtendedResourceProperties.description: The system generated resource properties associated with SQL databases, SQL containers, Gremlin databases and Gremlin graphs.

FailoverPolicies.description: The list of new failover policies for the failover priority change.

failoverPriority.description: The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.

id.description: The unique identifier of the region in which the database account replicates to. Example: <accountName>-<locationName>.

locationName.description: The name of the region in which the database account exists.

IPRangeFilter.description: Cosmos DB Firewall Support: This value specifies the set of IP addresses or IP address ranges in CIDR form to be included as the allowed list of client IPs for a given database account. IP addresses/ranges must be comma separated and must not contain any spaces.

indexes.description: List of indexes for this path

path.description: The path for which the indexing behavior applies to. Index paths typically start with root and end with wildcard (/path/*)

IncludedPath.description: The paths that are included in indexing

dataType.description: The datatype for which the indexing behavior is applied to.

precision.description: The precision of the index. -1 is maximum precision.

automatic.description: Indicates if the indexing policy is automatic

excludedPaths.description: List of paths to exclude from indexing

includedPaths.description: List of paths to include in the indexing

documentEndpoint.description: The connection endpoint for the specific region. Example: https://<accountName>-<locationName>.documents.azure.com:443/

failoverPriority.description: The failover priority of the region. A failover priority of 0 indicates a write region. The maximum value for a failover priority = (total number of regions - 1). Failover priority values must be unique for each of the regions in which the database account exists.

id.description: The unique identifier of the region within the database account. Example: <accountName>-<locationName>.

isZoneRedundant.description: Flag to indicate whether or not this region is an AvailabilityZone region

Resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: Profile, endpoint, etc.

display.description: The object that represents the operation.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

value.description: List of operations supported by the Resource Provider.

OperationListResult.description: Result of the request to list Resource Provider operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

partitionId.description: The partition id (GUID identifier) of the metric values.

partitionKeyRangeId.description: The partition key range id (integer identifier) of the metric values.

PartitionMetric.description: The metric values for a single partition.

value.description: The list of partition-level metrics for the account.

PartitionMetricListResult.description: The response to a list partition metrics request.

partitionId.description: The partition id (GUID identifier) of the usages.

partitionKeyRangeId.description: The partition key range id (integer identifier) of the usages.

PartitionUsage.description: The partition level usage data for a usage request.

value.description: The list of partition-level usages for the database. A usage is a point in time metric

PartitionUsagesResult.description: The response to a list partition level usage request.

Path.description: A path. These typically start with root (/path)

endTime.description: The end time for the metric (ISO-8601 format).

metricValues.description: The percentile metric values for the specified time window and timestep.

startTime.description: The start time for the metric (ISO-8601 format).

timeGrain.description: The time grain to be used to summarize the metric values.

value.description: The list of percentile metrics for the account.

PercentileMetricListResult.description: The response to a list percentile metrics request.

P10.description: The 10th percentile value for the metric.

P25.description: The 25th percentile value for the metric.

P50.description: The 50th percentile value for the metric.

P75.description: The 75th percentile value for the metric.

P90.description: The 90th percentile value for the metric.

P95.description: The 95th percentile value for the metric.

P99.description: The 99th percentile value for the metric.

ProvisioningState.description: The status of the Cosmos DB account at the time the operation was called. The status can be one of following. 'Creating'  the Cosmos DB account is being created. When an account is in Creating state, only properties that are specified as input for the Create Cosmos DB account operation are returned. 'Succeeded'  the Cosmos DB account is active for use. 'Updating'  the Cosmos DB account is being updated. 'Deleting'  the Cosmos DB account is being deleted. 'Failed'  the Cosmos DB account failed creation.

region.description: Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

RegionForOnlineOffline.description: Cosmos DB region to online or offline.

ShardKeys.description: The shard key and partition kind pair, only support "Hash" partition kind

path.description: The path for which the indexing behavior applies to. Index paths typically start with root and end with wildcard (/path/*)

SpatialType.description: Indicates the spatial type of index.

_colls.description: A system generated property that specified the addressable path of the collections resource.

_users.description: A system generated property that specifies the addressable path of the users resource.

TableCreateUpdateParameters.description: Parameters to create and update Cosmos DB Table.

TableCreateUpdateProperties.description: Properties to create and update Azure Cosmos DB Table.

TableGetProperties.description: The properties of an Azure Cosmos Table

value.description: List of Table and their properties.

TableListResult.description: The List operation response, that contains the Table and their properties.

id.description: Name of the Cosmos DB table

Tags.description: Tags are a list of key-value pairs that describe the resource. These tags can be used in viewing and grouping this resource (across resource groups). A maximum of 15 tags can be provided for a resource. Each tag must have a key no greater than 128 characters and value no greater than 256 characters. For example, the default experience for a template type is set with "defaultExperience": "Cassandra". Current "defaultExperience" values also include "Table", "Graph", "DocumentDB", and "MongoDB".

ThroughputSettingsGetProperties.description: The properties of an Azure Cosmos DB resource throughput

ThroughputSettingsGetResults.description: An Azure Cosmos DB resource throughput.

minimumThroughput.description: The minimum throughput of the resource

throughput.description: Value of the Cosmos DB resource throughput

ThroughputSettingsUpdateParameters.description: Parameters to update Cosmos DB resource throughput.

ThroughputSettingsUpdateProperties.description: Properties to update Azure Cosmos DB resource throughput.

paths.description: List of paths must be unique for each document in the Azure Cosmos DB service

UniqueKey.description: The unique key on that enforces uniqueness constraint on documents in the collection in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

uniqueKeys.description: List of unique keys on that enforces uniqueness constraint on documents in the collection in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

UniqueKeyPolicy.description: The unique key policy configuration for specifying uniqueness constraints on documents in the collection in the Azure Cosmos DB service.

quotaPeriod.description: The quota period used to summarize the usage values.

Usage.description: The usage data for a usage request.

value.description: The list of usages for the database. A usage is a point in time metric

UsagesResult.description: The response to a list usage request.

id.description: Resource ID of a subnet, for example: /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{groupName}/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/{virtualNetworkName}/subnets/{subnetName}.

ignoreMissingVNetServiceEndpoint.description: Create firewall rule before the virtual network has vnet service endpoint enabled.

apiVersionParameter.name: api-version
apiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2019-08-01.

filterParameter.name: $filter
filterParameter.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of metrics to return. The parameters that can be filtered are name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names), startTime, endTime, and timeGrain. The supported operator is eq.

partitionKeyRangeIdParameter.name: partitionKeyRangeId
partitionKeyRangeIdParameter.description: Partition Key Range Id for which to get data.

regionParameter.name: region
regionParameter.description: Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

resourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
resourceGroupNameParameter.description: Name of an Azure resource group.

sourceRegionParameter.name: sourceRegion
sourceRegionParameter.description: Source region from which data is written. Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

targetRegionParameter.name: targetRegion
targetRegionParameter.description: Target region to which data is written. Cosmos DB region, with spaces between words and each word capitalized.

usageFilterParameter.name: $filter
usageFilterParameter.description: An OData filter expression that describes a subset of usages to return. The supported parameter is name.value (name of the metric, can have an or of multiple names).
